Content-stakeholder finder

  • Stakeholders
  • Types & Topics

Working on a piece of content (or have an idea for one) and curious who needs to approve it for publication? Answer the following questions and we’ll point you in the right direction. If you still have questions, ask us in #g-content.

What type of content are you creating?

We rely on quite a few channels to get our message across. Scan the list below and check all that might apply to your content.

I’m creating… (check all that apply)
Content types

What is your content about?

Your content may require additional forms of approval if it substantially mentions a particular person or topic. What do we mean by substantially? If, for instance, you say “Our project uses the U.S. Web Design Standards, which were originally built by 18F and USDS…” you won’t have to get clearance from USDS before publishing your content.

My content substantially mentions… (check all that apply)
Topics

Keeping up appearances

While this finder works internally, our content is directly connected to stakeholders both internal and external. Help us out by preempting some potentially awkward conversations!

My content might… (check all that apply)
External stakeholders
